moves.2. Nf3 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. d4 Nc6 5. Nc3: Everything up to here has been fairly standard. I attack the bishop to relieve the pin.
moves.7... Bxf3 8. Bxf3 Qb6 9. Ne2: I move the knight to protect d4 and to free up the pawn on c3.
moves.9... Nf6 10. c3 Bd6 11. Bg5: I hastily attack the f6 knight and hang my b2 pawn.
moves.11... Qxb2 12. Bxf6 gxf6: but gain a doubled pawn for black and an opened king side.
moves.13. O-O O-O-O: It seems the doubled pawn has swayed black to castle queen side.
moves.14. Qa4: I move my queen to prevent the knight from heading to c4 via a5
moves.14... Qd2: Not sure where blacks queen is going.
moves.15. Rfd1: I attack the queen to get it out of my camp.
moves.15... Qg5 16. Rab1: planning on doubling up my rooks on the b file to attack b7.
moves.16... Rd7 17. Ng3: I move the knight to block the g file and to free up my bishop for a path to a6 via e2.
moves.17... Bxg3 18. fxg3 Qxg3: but I overlooked another pawn capture.
moves.22. Rc2: I attack the queen and pin the knight.
moves.22... Qd3 23. Rd1: I attack again just to push the queen to a less desirable spot.
moves.23... Qxd1: And to my surprise the queen took the rook?? Had the queen retreated to say g6, I don't think I could have won more than a pawn and the rook on h8 which doesn't seem to justify the queen sacrifice.
I check with the bishop making use of the rook pin.
moves.29... Nc6 30. Bxc6: I decide instead to further reduce the minor pieces between us for an easier endgame.
moves.30... bxc6 31. Qxa7+: And the rest is a fairly easy win for white.
2nd win to date as white against the GK intermediate (~1600) level computer. Thanks for watching. :)
